speaker: Frasier
text: [_into phone_] My eight year-old son is visiting me this  weekend, he asked specifically if I could arrange a tour  of the Microsoft complex, I was wondering what's your  policy on... [_pause_] I'm sorry to hear that. [_pause_]  You know, I don't often trade on my celebrity status,  but does the name Frasier Crane mean anything to you?  [_pause_] I'm sorry to hear that.  Well, erm, you know,  it's entirely possible that one day a relative of yours  may wish to tour my workplace... [_pause_] It's a radio  station!  Forget it! [_hangs up_]

speaker: Roz
text: If we'd even been close, that would be one thing, but I beat  that pack by a mile!  A mile!

speaker: Bulldog
text: Calm down, slugger, it's all right.

speaker: Roz
text: A mile!

speaker: Frasier
text: I take it you lost the game.

speaker: Bulldog
text: No, we won the game, but Roz got kicked out for arguing with  the ump!  She kicked dirt on his shoes, chest-butted him,  almost took a bite out of his finger when he stuck it in her  face.  You can't coach that kind of thing.

speaker: Roz
text: All right, the guy on second, one guy's out, I drive one to  the gap.  The throw-the-cop man is late, our guy stays at  home and I try to stretch it to a double.  I make a _beautiful_  hook slide right into the tag.  How can I be out?!

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm still trying to understand why you drove to the Gap in  the middle of the game!

speaker: Bulldog
text: I gotta go work on the line-up for Saturday's game.  You know,  I love being in charge.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, can I play second base?

speaker: Bulldog
text: Er, no, sorry, Liz Budner's playing second.

speaker: Roz
text: Liz Budner?!  Why?  What can she do that I can't?

speaker: Bulldog
text: It's what she will do that you won't!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Roz, erm, listen, didn't you used to date some executive  at Microsoft?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, [_in horror_] Scott Blankman!  Ugh, talk about your messy  break-ups.  Even after I dumped the guy, he kept calling me.  At first he'd make excuses - "Oh sorry, I hit the wrong  button on my speed dial" - and then he just gave up the  pretense and there'd be sobbing on the other end of the  line!  I finally said, "Scott, I never, ever want to talk  to you again!"  Why do you ask?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'd like you to give him a call.

speaker: Roz
text: What?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Frederick's coming to visit me this week.  The only  thing he asked for was a tour of Microsoft, and I sort of  already, well, promised that I could arrange it for him.

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier, you're asking me to call a man who camped outside  my apartment building and held a big sign up that said,  "Roz Doyle is afraid to love!"

speaker: Frasier
text: I understand.  I thought you'd be more sympathetic, that's  all.

speaker: Roz
text: I can't.  _Roz picks up her clipboard and studies it. Frasier starts to leave  the booth, but pauses at the door._

speaker: Frasier
text: I do recall a story you told me not long ago, about a young  girl living in Wisconsin who wanted desperately for her  mother to drive her to Chicago to see Bobby Sherman open  a shopping mall. [_Roz realizes_] But her mother was just too  busy.  And so what did that little girl do that night? She  cried herself to sleep on her little Bobby Sherman pillow.

speaker: Roz
text: [_picks up phone, to Frasier:_] I hate you!  _She dials as Frasier exits with a satisfied smile.    FADE OUT    Scene Two - Frasier's Apartment.  The doorbell sounds.  Frasier opens the door to Niles._

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Good morning, Frasier.  Is Frederick up yet?

speaker: Frasier
text: Actually he went out with his grandfather for an early  morning walk.

speaker: Niles
text: I went through some of my old albums this morning and found  a few photos of us when we were Frederick's age.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Lord.

speaker: Niles
text: I thought he might find them amusing.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh here, there we are, all dressed up for our first cub  scout hike!

speaker: Frasier
text: And the last!

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, well, we didn't exactly endear ourselves to the pack.  All the other kids had those knapsacks, we showed up with  those monogrammed train cases.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_looking at photo_] Niles, refresh my memory.  Why are we  wearing plastic snouts and a tiny little wading pool around  our waists?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, you've forgotten.  That Halloween we went as "The Bay of  Pigs."

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah!  Yes, as I recall nobody got it.  We finally had to take  to telling that we were "Swine Lake."  They didn't get that  either.  That was a long evening.

speaker: Niles
text: So, what do you have in store for Frederick this visit?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, we're going to go whale-watching, to the planetarium  and Roz is helping me arrange a tour of Microsoft.  It's the  one thing that Freddie's specifically requested.

speaker: Niles
text: Someone's making a run for "Dad of the Year."

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, you know how it is.  I don't get to see him as  often as I'd like.  Memories of this trip will have to last  until the next one.  Can you blame me for wanting it to be  perfect?

speaker: Freddie
text: Hi, Dad.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hello, Freddie.

speaker: Freddie
text: Dad, did Grandpa ever tell you the story of how he captured  four bank robbers with just a nightstick?

speaker: Frasier
text: No.  He did tell me how he captured two bank robbers with  just a revolver, his partner and a S.W.A.T. team.

speaker: Martin
text: They got there later!

speaker: Freddie
text: Hello, Uncle Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, Frederick.  My, aren't you getting big.

speaker: Freddie
text: I'm the same exact size I was the last time you saw me.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, your mother's cooking will do that for a growing boy!

speaker: Freddie
text: Are we going to Microsoft today?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, actually, Freddie, I thought we'd, er, go by the radio  station, I could show you where I work.  That'll be fun,  won't it?

speaker: Freddie
text: Yes.  When are we going to Microsoft?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well... Saturday.

speaker: Freddie
text: Excellent.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, good morning, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Niles
text: Good morning, Daphne.

speaker: Freddie
text: [_smitten_] Hi, Daphne.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello, Frederick.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Freddie, tell your dad what you saw in the park today.

speaker: Freddie
text: [_smitten_] Hi, Daphne.

speaker: Daphne
text: Frederick's my boyfriend.

speaker: Niles
text: [_covers jealousy with a laugh_] Oh, really?

speaker: Freddie
text: I've a present for you, wait here.

speaker: Martin
text: How cute, he's got a crush on you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, you should have seen him last night.  He spent the  entire evening sitting on Daphne's lap watching TV.

speaker: Niles
text: [_laughs a little to cover jealousy_] Really?

speaker: Daphne
text: And this morning I heard this soft little knocking at my door  and it was Frederick asking if he could climb into bed with  me.

speaker: Niles
text: [_jealous_] Really?

speaker: Freddie
text: This is for you.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, isn't this lovely?  Look, here's Frederick and here I am.  And what are we doing?

speaker: Freddie
text: Getting married.

speaker: Niles
text: [_spite_] Really?! [_slams photos down onto table_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, come on, Frederick.  Let's go hang this on the fridge.

speaker: Freddie
text: Okay.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, do you really think it's healthy for a little boy  to be so obsessed with a woman he can't possibly have?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, have you actually sunk so low as to be jealous of him?

speaker: Niles
text: No, I'm not jealous, I'm just a bit, well... maybe envious.

speaker: Martin
text: That's ridiculous!  What have you got to be envious of?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_o.s_] Hold on!  _Daphne runs back and forth through the room with Freddie clung to  her having a fun piggyback ride._

speaker: Freddie
text: Wheeeee!  _Niles looks on in anger.    FADE TO:_  **WHO DELIVERED THE  GETTYSBURG ADDRESS?**  _Scene Three - Radio Station.  Frederick enters with Frasier._

speaker: Frasier
text: And this is the booth where it all happens.

speaker: Freddie
text: Very impressive!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, this is the talk-back button here, if I want to talk  to Roz, and this is the cough button if I want to mute the  mike.  Oh, and this button here's very special.  It sends a  death ray shooting from the phone of any caller who annoys me.

speaker: Freddie
text: You wish.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I do.  _Bulldog and Roz enter.  Roz is on crutches.  Freddie is facing the  control panel and so the two don't notice him when they enter_

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, okay, Roz, what have we done to ourselves today?

speaker: Roz
text: Well, we went out last night to celebrate our big win.  I had  a few margaritas.  Someone started a conga line, I wasn't  going to get in it but then Gary, our shortstop, got on the  end of the line and that man has a butt that makes you want  to reach out with both hands and... [_Frasier spins Frederick  round to face Roz_] Give Freddie a big Seattle hug!

speaker: Freddie
text: [_hugs her, then:_] Good save, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Thank you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Freddie, I don't believe you've met Bulldog.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey, kid.

speaker: Freddie
text: Why are you called Bulldog?

speaker: Bulldog
text: Er, people have just always called me that.

speaker: Freddie
text: But why?

speaker: Bulldog
text: I don't know...

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, all right, Bulldog, er, Roz and I have a show to  prepare...

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_interrupts_] No, no, wait a minute, this is important.  Why  do people call me Bulldog?  There has to be a reason. [_a  woman enters to pick up some papers, Bulldog barks at her  and she runs out_] This is gonna drive me nuts!

speaker: Roz
text: So who's going to sub for me in the game on Saturday, we've  got to have a ninth body out there or we forfeit.

speaker: Bulldog
text: All right, er.... How about Mindy Guffrey?

speaker: Roz
text: Eight months pregnant.

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_worried, counts:_] July, August, September, October, November,  December, January... [_smiles relieved_]

speaker: Roz
text: Anyway, you'd better find somebody else and speaking of bad  news, Frasier, I finally got a call from Scott Blancman...

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Roz... Freddie, why don't you talk to Bulldog for a  minute, I have to discuss something with Roz.

speaker: Freddie
text: Okay.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Yeah, no problem.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Oh, hey, hey, in a little while, I'm going to bring in my  cart.  You can hit the gong.

speaker: Freddie
text: Why?

speaker: Bulldog
text: It's loud, I make a lot of loud noises on my show.

speaker: Freddie
text: Why?

speaker: Bulldog
text: I don't know.  Boy, I'm starting to get a headache.

speaker: Freddie
text: If you need a softball player, why don't you use my dad?

speaker: Bulldog
text: Oh, yeah, right. [_laughs_]

speaker: Freddie
text: Isn't he good?

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_realises, acts_] Oh, yeah, yeah, he's great, he is the best,  you know.  I wish he could play but I think your dad's busy  Saturday.

speaker: Freddie
text: He's taking me to Microsoft.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Yep, yeah, right.  Oh, man, I wish he could play because if  he were playing we'd win for sure.

speaker: Roz
text: I'm sorry, Frasier, that's all I can do.  Scott quit  Microsoft right after we broke up.

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't look forward to telling Frederick.  He'll be so  disappointed.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, you know, if you want the tour of a seminary, I've  got an in there now.

speaker: Bulldog
text: I don't know, I give up.

speaker: Freddie
text: Abraham Lincoln!  What school did you go to?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Frederick.

speaker: Freddie
text: Dad, I don't want to go to Microsoft anymore.

speaker: Frasier
text: You... don't?

speaker: Bulldog
text: Oh, hey, yes he does.  Wait a minute, wait a minute.  Hey,  what kind of boy wouldn't want to spend a day at Microsoft?

speaker: Frasier
text: Stay out of this. [_pause_] Freddie... Frederick, you know,  this is your vacation, you're the boss.  Whatever you say  goes.

speaker: Freddie
text: Great, I want to see you play in the softball team.

speaker: Frasier
text: What?!

speaker: Freddie
text: You could take Roz's place.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I... You know, as much as I'd love to play softball, I  really don't think that Bulldog wants me to.

speaker: Freddie
text: Yes, he does.  He said you were the best.  Right?

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_through gritted teeth_] That's what I said.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, thank you, Bulldog.

speaker: Freddie
text: So, you'll play?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I don't see how I can refuse.

speaker: Freddie
text: Great, I can't wait to tell Daphne.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes, well, speaking of Daphne.  While you're waiting for  Daphne, why don't you go out, get yourself a candy bar out  of the machine.

speaker: Freddie
text: Mommy says candy rots tooth enamel.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, chew on the side of your mouth, rot your baby  teeth.

speaker: Frasier
text: Bulldog, what the hell do you think you're doing, telling  him I'm a good softball player?

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey, I was trying to be nice.  You want me to tell him  you're a big lame-o?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, I don't.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey, look, I know how tough it is when you're a kid and you  find out you're dad's not as great as you thought.  Look, I  was about Frederick's age when, well, I came home, my mom  was out and I caught my dad with another woman.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Bulldog, I'm sorry.

speaker: Bulldog
text: No, no, wait, you haven't heard the bad part yet!  She was  ugly, doc.  I mean coyote ugly.  My own dad.  And the best  excuse he could come up with was, "Hey, you don't look at  the mantle when you're poking the fire!" [_pause_] Hey, I just  got that! [_laughs and exits_]  _End of Act One    Act Two    Scene One - Caf e Nervosa.  Niles and Frasier are discussing recent events on the window seat.  _

speaker: Frasier
text: I just keep thinking back to that time when Dad made us try  Little League.  I will never forget the humiliation of getting  up to bat for the first time in my life and hearing the other  team all cry out, "Move in, everybody.  Crane's up!"

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, but they moved right back out again after you took your  first swing.

speaker: Frasier
text: Only because the bat flew out of my hands!

speaker: Niles
text: You worry too much, your co-workers aren't expecting you to  play brilliantly.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I can live with playing badly in front of my co-workers,  it's Frederick I'm worried about.  He's still at that age  where he thinks his father can do anything.

speaker: Niles
text: Every child at some point must discover that his father is  not a superhero.

speaker: Frasier
text: I know.

speaker: Niles
text: It's a healthy part of the developmental process.

speaker: Frasier
text: I know, I know some day he's going to have to learn that I'm  not perfect, it's just that I was hoping it might be  something less humiliating like seeing me fast dance at a  family wedding.

speaker: Niles
text: You consider that less humiliating?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well...

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello, look who's here.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, did you two have fun while I was at work?

speaker: Freddie
text: [_smitten with Daphne_] Yes.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, yes, we went to the amusement park, we had a lovely  time.  Only I think the ferris wheel scared him a bit; he  spent the whole ride hugging me for dear life.

speaker: Niles
text: [_well... maybe envious_] Really?

speaker: Freddie
text: Her hair smells like strawberries.

speaker: Niles
text: It smells like peach blossoms, lavender and vanilla!

speaker: Niles
text: [_covers_] From over here at least. [_Daphne laughs_]

speaker: Freddie
text: Uncle Niles, are you coming to watch my dad play in the  softball team?  He's the best one on the team.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, of course I am, Freddie.  I'll be there sitting right  between you and Daphne.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_oblivious_] Oh, come on, Frederick, let's go get some hot  chocolate.

speaker: Freddie
text: OK. [_they go to the counter_]

speaker: Frasier
text: So you see the problem?

speaker: Niles
text: [_looking onto Freddie at the counter_] I certainly do!

speaker: Frasier
text: No, that's _your_ problem.  The trouble is that I promised  Frederick I would play on Saturday.  I guess I'm left with  only one choice.

speaker: Niles
text: You're gonna fake an injury?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, of course not, I'm going to learn how to play softball.

speaker: Niles
text: In two days?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, back in college, when Stu Oberfelt got sick, I learnt  the role of Mercutio in just a day and a half.  I was  brilliant.  Fighting in the duelling scene, the audience was  on the edge of their seats.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, and they were under them when the sword flew out of  your hand!   **THE UNNATURAL**  _Scene Two - Softball Court.  Martin and Frasier enter the softball practice court.  Frasier is  wearing softball clothes - obviously Martin's which read "CRANE" on  the back._

speaker: Frasier
text: Gee, Dad, I want to thank you for helping me out with this.

speaker: Martin
text: Ah, don't mention it, we're going to whip you right into  shape!

speaker: Frasier
text: It must have been kinda disappointing for you; I never took  any interest in this sort of thing as a kid.

speaker: Martin
text: No, I understood.

speaker: Frasier
text: I guess it's a little complex I must have developed.  When I  was growing up, you know, the doorbell'd ring, I'd run to  answer it and then there'd be the neighbourhood kids with  their baseball gloves and their bats looking for somebody  else to join their game.  They'd say, "Hey, can your Dad  come out and play?"

speaker: Martin
text: [_laughs_] Well, never mind that.  You know, it's kind of fun  to finally be out here.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_laughs_] Oh, at the risk of sounding like Stanley courting  Blanche DuBois in "Streetcar...", "We've had this date with  each other from the very beginning."

speaker: Martin
text: I knew you'd ruin it!

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry.

speaker: Martin
text: Come on, put your helmet on.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_tries to_] Dad, gee, it's kinda tight.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, well, it's supposed too.  Stops you from getting hurt.

speaker: Martin
text: There you go, now.  Get your bat, get into the stands just  like I told you.  I'm gonna turn the machine on.  You know,  the good thing about these balls is that they're all at the  same level so you can work on your form and your timing, all  right?  Okay, now here we go.  _Martin stands outside, puts money in and clicks for the first ball.  It shoots past Frasier.  He dodges it rather than hitting it._

speaker: Frasier
text: What is that, a pitching machine or a particle accelerator?!

speaker: Martin
text: All right, all right, I'll crank it down to a lower setting.  [_does so_] Okay, now, just remember; Left elbow in, right  elbow up, knees in, all your weight on the balls of your  feet, okay, now, just step into the pitch.

speaker: Martin
text: Now.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh yeah, and swing the bat.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, can't you just slow it down a little bit?

speaker: Martin
text: All right, all right, but if any of the other fathers come  back here, I'm taking it off the pee-wee setting.  Okay, all  right, now, from the hips.  Nice an' easy, don't try to kill  it, just try to make contact, okay, are you ready?

speaker: Frasier
text: Ready.  _The ball fires.  Frasier swings for it without any contact.  He falls over on his follow-through while throwing the bat to the  other side of the court.  Some men are watching and laughing._

speaker: Frasier
text: What are they looking at?  Dad, they're looking at me!

speaker: Martin
text: [_to men_] Get out of here!  Go on, buzz off!  _The men leave as Frasier resumes posture.    FADE TO:_  **15%...20% IF THE  SERVICE IS EXCEPTIONAL**  _Scene Three - Softball Court.  Later on, Frasier is still trying to bat.  Once again, a ball whizzes  pass him, he tries to hit it but, as before, falls over and throws  the bat away._

speaker: Frasier
text: Did you hear that?  Did you hear that?  I touched it that  time, I did!

speaker: Martin
text: No, I think that was my knee cracking!  Hey, you're doing a  lot better, though.  That's six in a row without hitting  yourself in your kidney on your follow-through.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, who am I kidding?  This is hopeless!

speaker: Martin
text: [_steps inside_] Oh, well you tried anyway.  Why don't we just  try changing bats?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Dad, please, I couldn't hit that ball if I had a sofa  cushion!

speaker: Martin
text: All right, okay, Softball's not your game.  It's no big deal,  now Freddie'll understand that.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I suppose.  In time he well, it's just that...  _Frasier tries to take his helmet off, however it pains him through  the tightness._

speaker: Frasier
text: ...no boy ever forgets the first time he finds that his dad  isn't perfect.  It's not what I want him to take away with  him on his trip.  Anyway, thanks for your help.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, don't mention it.  So, Frasier, em, [_laughs_] what was it  for you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Huh?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, you know, em, when you first found out that I was less  than perfect?

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't know.

speaker: Martin
text: I thought you said a kid never forgets the first time.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well... Maybe it was no one time.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, so, it's a lot of times?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, no, I'm just not very comfortable talking about it  right now.

speaker: Martin
text: Why?  You're not going to hurt my feelings, I'm just curious.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, all right.  Back in third grade, you took me and  some of the boys from the Math Club out to pizza.  When the  check came, you couldn't figure out the tip in your head.

speaker: Martin
text: I can't do math in my head, that's your big disappointment?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it was at the time!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I wonder if I can calculate in my head how many hits  you got today?  Let me think, er... oh, it's zero!

speaker: Frasier
text: Fine!  Fine, Dad, get defensive!  I was eight years old.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, that's the one shaped like a snowman, right?!

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry I even brought it up.

speaker: Martin
text: All right.

speaker: Frasier
text: I guess I'm just going to have to bite the bullet, sit  Frederick down on Saturday before the game and tell him the  truth.  It's not a conversation I'm looking forward to but I  should prepare him for the fact that his daddy's not going  to be hitting any grand slams on Saturday. [_pause_] Or am I?  Wait, a grand slam is...

speaker: Martin
text: You aren't.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, anyway, I suppose one consolation is, you know, as  disappointed as I was with you after the pizza incident,  here we are, all those years later, out at a batting cage.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, that's right.  Come on, I'll get us a couple of beers.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thanks, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: And, er, how many of these shiny things do you need for...

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, shut up!  _Frasier and Martin exit.    Scene Four - Frasier's Apartment.  On Saturday, the doorbell rings. Frasier answers the door to Niles.  Frasier is wearing a KACL "CRANE" softball shirt.  Niles is in his  normal Armani attire._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, you look like an authentic jock.  I'm half-tempted  to hand over my lunch money.

speaker: Frasier
text: Is that your idea of appropriate baseball-watching attire?

speaker: Niles
text: Obviously you failed to detect the subtle diamond pattern in  my tie!

speaker: Niles
text: So, how did your little talk go with Frederick?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I haven't been able to bring myself to do it yet.  I  guess it's about you going to any lengths to avoid looking  foolish in front of your son.

speaker: Martin
text: Look what Mrs. Thorkenson was throwing out.  Boy, the guys at  McGinty's are going to love this!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, anyhoo...

speaker: Frasier
text: Frederick, what have I told you about running in the house?

speaker: Freddie
text: You told me to not run in the house.

speaker: Frasier
text: Frederick, what have I told you about splitting infinitives?

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, let the boy be a boy.

speaker: Daphne
text: Don't run away!  I saw you!  Your son just walked right in  on me in the shower!

speaker: Frasier
text: Frederick!

speaker: Freddie
text: Dad, all I really saw was...

speaker: Frasier
text: I am very disappointed in you, young man!

speaker: Niles
text: Let the boy finish!

speaker: Freddie
text: All I really saw was a lot of steam.

speaker: Freddie
text: I'm sorry, Daphne, I didn't know you were in the shower.  Now you hate me.

speaker: Daphne
text: I don't hate you, you just have to promise to knock before  you enter a room, okay?

speaker: Freddie
text: Sorry, dad.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's okay, son.

speaker: Freddie
text: So, when are we going to the game?

speaker: Frasier
text: Er, in a bit, er... First we have to have a conversation,  the two of us.  Er, Uncle Niles, do you think you could give  us a moment alone?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, of course.  I'll freshen up for the game. [_aside to  Freddie:_] You can fool them, but you can't fool me!  I'm  on to you, little man! [_exits_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Come on, Freddie.  Come and have a seat, here. [_he does_]  Okay, you're going to see me play some softball today, and  I'm not going to play very well.  You see, I'm not a good  softball player.

speaker: Freddie
text: But Bulldog said you were the best.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I know, he was just lying in order to be nice.  The  truth is, I stink. I can't catch, I can't throw, I can't hit.

speaker: Freddie
text: [_taking it well_] Oh.

speaker: Frasier
text: So, it must be pretty disappointing to hear for the first  time that your Dad's not perfect, but...

speaker: Freddie
text: It's not the first time.  You couldn't fix my computer, you  thought Venus was the North Star, and I've seen you run!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, why didn't you mention any of these things to me  before?

speaker: Freddie
text: I thought it might hurt your self-esteem!

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, actually, Frederick, I'm really okay with those things,  I am.  I just want you to know that it's okay for you to feel  bad about them.  You see, when I was your age, I felt really  bad about learning that your Grandpa can't do math in his  head.  I learned later, of course, that that really wasn't  very important because he can do so many other things so  well.

speaker: Freddie
text: [_amazed_] Grandpa can't do math in his head?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, but....

speaker: Martin
text: What are you doing telling that for?!

speaker: Frasier
text: I was making a point!

speaker: Freddie
text: You mean you can't do it at all?!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, yeah, sure I can, Freddie.

speaker: Freddie
text: I knew you could.  What's seven times fifteen?  You can do  it, Grandpa.  _Frederick looks at Martin.  Martin looks at Frasier who writes in the  air "105."_

speaker: Freddie
text: Oh, Grandpa!

speaker: Martin
text: Thanks a lot, Frasier!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I tried, for God's sake.

speaker: Daphne
text: Ready for the game?

speaker: Freddie
text: [_miffed_] Yeah.

speaker: Daphne
text: You don't sound too exited.

speaker: Freddie
text: I just found out that Dad's bad at softball and Grandpa can't  do math in his head.

speaker: Daphne
text: Those things aren't important.  What can I do to make you  feel better?

speaker: Freddie
text: Maybe a hug?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, come here.  _Daphne picks up Freddie and gives him a big hug.  Over her shoulder,  his sad face slowly turns to a sly smile.  Niles catches the look and  returns it as Uncle and Nephew share the same thoughts.    End of Act Two_
